activities:
As a service provider for its customers, Insurance Services Office, Inc. (“ISO”) receives personal data from its customers’ consumers located in the EEA and Switzerland.  ISO’s customers provide the personal data to ISO in connection with ISO’s provision of services to its customers.  The types of personal data ISO’s customers provide include property and casualty claims information such as names, addresses, dates of births, policy numbers, Social Security numbers, and government issued identification numbers.  Limited sensitive data, such as health information associated with insurance claims, also may be included among the data provided to ISO by its customers.  ISO processes these personal data in the U.S. for the purposes of providing technology support services including backup storage, system support, and application maintenance.

ISO also obtains personal data directly from consumers when, for example, they visit an ISO website and provide personal data online.  In addition, ISO obtains personal data, such as contact information, in connection with maintaining its customer relationships and providing products and services to its customers.

ISO obtains and processes personal data about its employees when carrying out and supporting human resources functions and activities, including: (1) recruiting and hiring job applicants; (2) performing background checks and verifying references; (3) managing employee headcount; (4) managing employee performance; (5) determining employee compensation; (6) managing the employee termination process; and (7) for other general human resources purposes.
